channel.title: Java problem with Windows 64 bit
channel.description: I have windows vista 64 bit, and whenever I try to play a server on a downloaded client, it suddenly closes and I get an error, which basically says something about "mixed mode" or "crossed compatibility" with "amd64". I have tried downloading and redownloading the 32bit versions and 64 bit versions of java and jdk, and neither seem to work.

item.title: Java problem with Windows 64 bit
item.dc:creator: @Caffeine Caffeine
item.description:
@Caffeine wrote:

I get the same error… I’ll pm you if I fix it.

Read full topic

@sickedank wrote:

I’ve downloaded the lastest versions of JDK and JRE by themselves only. And I’ve done it multiple times. There was no error when i downloaded it.

item.title: Java problem with Windows 64 bit
item.dc:creator: @xxlifeskilxx xxlifeskilxx
item.description:
@xxlifeskilxx wrote:

ok this is tricky, i had this, what you do is you go to the java website.i think you downloaded it with netbeans. get the regulat version WITH JDK. so thhat way you get the latest version of JDK and you have a fixed error. there was probably an error when you downloaded it.soooo yea

item.title: Java problem with Windows 64 bit
item.dc:creator: @sickedank sickedank
item.description:
@sickedank wrote:

computer.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2009, 10:06:04 am[/size][hr]here is the exact error:

[code]# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d8418c6, pid=5400, tid=1104

JRE version: 6.0_14-b08

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (14.0-b16 mixed mode windows-amd64 )

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x518c6]

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 07, 2009, 10:44:24 am[/size][hr]anyone?

@sickedank wrote:

I have windows vista 64 bit, and whenever I try to play a server on a downloaded client, it suddenly closes and I get an error, which basically says something about “mixed mode” or “crossed compatibility” with “amd64”. I have tried downloading and redownloading the 32bit versions and 64 bit versions of java and jdk, and neither seem to work.
